column4: hey people I'm wondering if someone could give me a hand. I set up a previous ubuntu but i had a keyboard AND mouse problem and I was wondering will this new release, 7.04, be any different? :S
i'v had SuSe for a wile but i miss pretty ubuntu
an now GRUB wont load cause I had to open recovery console and do chkdsk on my harddrive
but it refuses to load grub now
it's documented in the ubuntu wiki how to restore grub. all you need is a boot disk (install live cd would do)
i hear different stories. ppl on recent hardare with 64bit vistas prais it, others on older hardware and/or 32 bit vista hate it. it defenately burns a lot of ressources.
on a side note, it was also reported o swallow little kittens alive, so it must be evil:-P
I'l definitely stay away from it now
It looks so shiny even though I've heard it has immense driver incompatibility

it seems to me, that there is really no need for the latest and greates from redmond. they have stripped all innovative features from vista, so it's basicly an XP with a 3d desktop. and as i keep saying: never change a winning system. why upgrade t obeta test another 2 years? but ths is something fro #ubuntu-offtopic
if you had windows ME you' know .. otherwise when bored some day, install it ... you'll be surprised how stable xp is :)
ahhh right. I think I get you now
